#Text=How to Prepare Quinoa
#Text=Quinoa is known as the little rice of Peru .
#Text=The Incas treated the crop as sacred and referred to quinoa as " chisaya mama " or " mother of all grains . " [ 1 ]

column1: #Text=By tradition , the Inca emperor would sow the first seeds of the season using " golden implements . "
#Text=Quinoa is rich in protein and much lighter than other grains .
#Text=It is much easier to prepare than rice and is rapidly gaining in popularity , especially among vegetarians who value its high protein levels .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=1 cup quinoa
#Text=2 cups water ( or broth )
#Text=Olive oil to taste ( Optional )
#Text=1/2 teaspoon salt ( Optional )
#Text=Method 1 Cooking On A Stove Top
#Text=Rinse the grains of quinoa in water .
#Text=You can skip this step if you have purchased pre-rinsed quinoa in a box .
#Text=To rinse , place the measured grain in a strainer under running water for a few minutes .
#Text=This is necessary to remove the excess saponins on the outside of the grains which impart a bitter flavor to quinoa if not removed .
#Text=Toast quinoa in a saucepan ( optional ) .
#Text=Drizzle a bit of olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat .
#Text=Add the quinoa and cook for about 1 minute .
#Text=This brings out quinoa 's nutty flavor .
#Text=Cook the quinoa .
#Text=Place two parts water or stock to one part of quinoa in a saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to a boil .
#Text=Cover and reduce heat to low .
#Text=Simmer the quinoa for about 15 minutes or until the grain becomes translucent and the white germ forms a visible spiral on the exterior of the quinoa grain .
#Text=Try to ensure there is an al dente bite to the germ , in the same way as pasta .
#Text=Quinoa will continue cooking for a bit even after you take it off the heat .
#Text=Take the quinoa off the heat and let stand , covered , for 5 minutes .
#Text=This will give it time to absorb any moisture that might still be in the pan .
#Text=Uncover and fluff with a fork .
#Text=The quinoa should look light and fluffy , and you should be able to see the germ separating from the seed .
#Text=Serve .
#Text=Freshly cooked quinoa should be served immediately to retain nutritional value and a good flavor .
#Text=Serve with :
#Text=Stir-fry , using the quinoa as a substitute for rice .
#Text=Curry .
#Text=Braised meat .
#Text=In a salad .
#Text=Virtually any other combination you can think of !
#Text=Method 2 Cooking In a Rice Cooker
#Text=Rinse 1 cup of quinoa in a fine mesh sieve under cold water .
#Text=If you bought packaged quinoa , this step is n't always necessary , but it 's better to be safe than sorry .
#Text=Pour quinoa into rice cooker .
#Text=One option is to toast the quinoa before placing in the rice cooker .
#Text=See Step # 2 in Method One above for directions .
#Text=Add 2 cups of liquid and 1/2 teaspoon of salt into the rice cooker .
#Text=Water , chicken stock or broth , or vegetable stock all work .
#Text=Cook for approximately 15 minutes .
#Text=Some rice cooker will have different settings instead of a simple " cook " option .
#Text=Try the " white rice " option if your rice cooker gives you several options .

column1: #Text=Let stand for about 5 minutes .
#Text=Fluff with a fork and serve .
#Text=Method 3 Cooking In the Oven
#Text=Preheat oven to 350 ° F ( 177 ° C ) .
#Text=Arrange rack in the middle of the oven .
#Text=Rinse quinoa thoroughly in a fine mesh seive under cold water .
#Text=In a medium saucepan , heat up 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over medium-low heat .
#Text=Add onions , peppers , mushrooms , or any other type of desired vegetable or herb into the saucepan ( optional ) .
#Text=Cook onions until they are translucent , but not burned .
#Text=Sweat the peppers or vegetables along with the onions .
#Text=Add the quinoa and salt to the saucepan , stirring until completely incorporated .
#Text=This should take no longer than 30 seconds .
#Text=Add one cup of broth and one cup of water to the saucepan and bring to a boil over medium high heat .
#Text=Once a boil is reached , transfer quinoa to a 8-by-8-inch baking dish . [ 2 ]
#Text=Spread out quinoa evenly and cover baking dish completely with aluminum foil .
#Text=Cook the quinoa in the oven for roughly 20 minutes , or until most of the liquid is gone .
#Text=Remove the aluminum foil from the baking dish , add cheese or other seasonings , and bake for an additional 5 minutes .
#Text=After 5 minutes , the quinoa should be fully cooked .
#Text=Serve and enjoy !
